intro: Oldenlandia mitrasacmoides subsp. trachymenoides, commonly known as the slender oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is characterized by its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
